original_theorem:
If $\mathbf{X}$ and $\mathbf{Y}$ are
 in $\R^n,$ then
$$
|\mathbf{X}-\mathbf{Y}|\ge\left| |\mathbf{X}|-|\mathbf{Y}|\right|.
$$

We can assume the following statement(s) without a proof. 

If $\mathbf{X}$ and $\mathbf{Y}$ are in $\R^n,$ then
\begin{equation}\label{eq:5.1.6}
|\mathbf{X}+\mathbf{Y}|\le |\mathbf{X}|+|\mathbf{Y}|,
\end{equation}
with equality if and only if one of the vectors is a nonnegative
multiple of the other$.$
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem vector_sub_norm_ge_abs_norm_sub_norm {n : ℕ} (X Y : Fin n → ℝ) :
  ‖X - Y‖ ≥ |‖X‖ - ‖Y‖| := by
```

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• $\mathbf{X}$ and $\mathbf{Y}$ are vectors in $\mathbb{R}^n$ [tc_1]
• For any vectors $\mathbf{U}, \mathbf{V}$ in $\mathbb{R}^n$, the triangle inequality holds: $|\mathbf{U}+\mathbf{V}|\le |\mathbf{U}|+|\mathbf{V}|$ [tc_2]
Therefore, we conclude:
• $|\mathbf{X}|\le |\mathbf{Y}|+|\mathbf{X}-\mathbf{Y}|$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
have l1 : ‖X‖ ≤ ‖X - Y‖ + ‖Y‖ :=
    calc
      ‖X‖ = ‖(X - Y) + Y‖ := by rw [sub_add_cancel]
      _ ≤ ‖X - Y‖ + ‖Y‖ := by apply norm_add_le
